verb.description: To swear falsely. Also with object with clause as object.
Refl. Chiefly regional. To perjure oneself.

origin: Old English; earliest use found in Old English Martyrology. Cognate with Old Swedish mensväria (Swedish † mensvärja), Old Danish mensvaeriae (Danish mensvaerge) from the Germanic base of man + the Germanic base of swear; compare also Middle Low German mēne swēren.
